1.brief: to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
'I pray', 'now', or 'then'; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction
there is or are (or any other form of the verb to be, as may suit the connection)
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
near, with or among; often in general, to
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
sacred (ceremonially or morally); (as noun) God (by eminence), an angel, a saint, a sanctuary
to turn; by implication, to face, i.e. appear, look, etc.

2.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to open, i.e. be (causatively, make) roomy; usually figuratively (in a mental or moral sense) to be (causatively, make) simple or (in a sinister way) delude
to die (literally or figuratively); causatively, to kill

3.brief: to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
to root, i.e. strike into the soil, or (by implication) to pluck from it
to scoop out, i.e. (figuratively) to malign or execrate (i.e. stab with words)
(adjectively) at home; hence (by implication of satisfaction) lovely; also (noun) a home, of God (temple), men (residence), flocks (pasture), or wild animals (den)

4.brief: to widen (in any direction), i.e. (intransitively) recede or (transitively) remove (literally or figuratively, of place or relation)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
to crumble; transitively, to bruise (literally or figuratively)
an opening, i.e. door or gate
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense

5.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
severed, i.e. harvest (as reaped), the crop, the time, the reaper, or figuratively; also a limb (of a tree, or simply foliage)
near, with or among; often in general, to
to take (in the widest variety of applications)
to inhale eagerly; figuratively, to cover; by implication, to be angry; also to hasten
probably a force, whether of men, means or other resources; an army, wealth, virtue, valor, strength

6.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to sprout (transitive or intransitive, literal or figurative)
toil, i.e. wearing effort; hence, worry, wheth. of body or mind

7.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
toil, i.e. wearing effort; hence, worry, wheth. of body or mind
to bear young; causatively, to beget; medically, to act as midwife; specifically, to show lineage
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
a live coal; by analogy lightning; figuratively, an arrow, (as flashing through the air); specifically, fever
to soar, i.e. be lofty; figuratively, to be haughty
to fly; also (by implication of dimness) to faint (from the darkness of swooning)

8.brief: properly, to tread or frequent; usually to follow (for pursuit or search); by implication, to seek or ask; specifically to worship
near, with or among; often in general, to
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
near, with or among; often in general, to

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)

9.brief: to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
properly, perhaps to separate, i.e. distinguish (literally or figuratively); by implication, to be (causatively, make) great, difficult, wonderful
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
a number, definite (arithmetical) or indefinite (large, innumerable; small, a few); also (abstractly) narration

10.brief: to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, separate by awall, i.e. outside, outdoors

11.brief: to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
altitude, i.e. concretely (an elevated place), abstractly (elevation, figuratively (elation), or adverbially (aloft)
to be ashy, i.e. darkcolored; by implication, to mourn (in sackcloth or sordid garments)
to be (causatively, make) lofty, especially inaccessible; by implication, safe, strong; used literally and figuratively

12.brief: to break up (usually figuratively), i.e. to violate, frustrate
a contrivance, i.e. (concretely) a texture, machine, or (abstractly) intention, plan (whether bad, a plot; or good, advice)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
support or (by implication) ability, i.e. (direct) help, (in purpose) an undertaking, (intellectual) understanding

13.brief: to catch (in a net, trap or pit); generally, to capture or occupy; also to choose (by lot); figuratively, to cohere
advice; by implication, plan; also prudence
to twine, i.e. (literally) to struggle or (figuratively) be (morally) tortuous
properly, to be liquid or flow easily, i.e. (by implication); to hurry (in a good or a bad sense); often used (with another verb) adverbially, promptly

14.brief: to come in contact with, whether by accident or violence; figuratively, to concur
the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity
to feel of; by implication, to grope
a light (i.e. window); dual double light, i.e. noon

15.brief: properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
strong (usu. in a bad sense, hard, bold, violent)

16.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, dangling, i.e. (by implication) weak or thin
literally a cord (as an attachment); figuratively, expectancy
to draw together, i.e. close; by implication, to leap (by contracting the limbs); specifically, to die (from gathering up the feet)
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to

17.brief: happiness; only in masculine plural construction as interjection, how happy!
a man in general (singly or collectively)
to be right (i.e. correct); reciprocal, to argue; causatively, to decide, justify or convict
properly, chastisement; figuratively, reproof, warning or instruction; also restraint
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing

18.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
properly, to feel pain; by implication, to grieve; figuratively, to spoil
to wrap firmly (especially a turban, compress, or saddle); figuratively, to stop, to rule
to dash asunder; by implication, to crush, smash or violently plunge; figuratively, to subdue or destroy
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
properly, to mend (by stitching), i.e. (figuratively) to cure

19.brief: six (as an overplus  beyond five or the fingers of the hand); as ord. sixth
tightness (i.e. figuratively, trouble); transitively, a female rival:
to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense
seven (as the sacred full one); also (adverbially) seven times; by implication, a week; by extension, an indefinite number
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

properly, to touch, i.e. lay the hand upon (for any purpose; euphemistically, to lie with a woman); by implication, to reach (figuratively, to arrive, acquire); violently, to strike (punish, defeat, destroy, etc.)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)

20.brief: to sever, i.e. ransom; gener. to release, preserve
death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin
a battle (i.e. the engagement); generally, war (i.e. warfare)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement

21.brief: the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)

22.brief: hunger (as making to stoop with emptiness and pain)
to laugh (in pleasure or detraction); by implication, to play
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten

23.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
a compact (because made by passing between pieces of flesh)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
to be safe (in mind, body or estate); figuratively, to be (causatively, make) completed; by implication, to be friendly; by extension, to reciprocate (in various applications)

24.brief: to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace
a tent (as clearly conspicuous from a distance)
to visit (with friendly or hostile intent); by analogy, to oversee, muster, charge, care for, miss, deposit, etc.
(adjectively) at home; hence (by implication of satisfaction) lovely; also (noun) a home, of God (temple), men (residence), flocks (pasture), or wild animals (den)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to miss; hence (figuratively and generally) to sin; by inference, to forfeit, lack, expiate, repent, (causatively) lead astray, condemn

25.brief: to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
seed; figuratively, fruit, plant, sowing-time, posterity
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

26.brief: to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
near, with or among; often in general, to
to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
a stack of sheaves; by analogy, a tomb
time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.

27.brief: properly, to penetrate; hence, to examine intimately
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
